intro: Bidens holwayi, commonly known as the yellow crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. Its yellow flowers bloom in the summer, and it produces small, hairy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Bidens holwayi is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
